data.title: Find the good string
data.statement: You must find the string containing the <<greatest percentage of lowercase English alphabetical characters ({{a}}-{{z}})>>. This percentage is calculated by dividing the total number of lowercase English alphabetical characters by the total number of characters in the string, including whitespace and special characters.

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testIn:
2
I am the good one
You not right: Hahahahahahahahahahahahaha!

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn:
2
You not right: Hahahahahahahahahahahahaha!
I am the good one

Very Strange !!!
Extraordinary
I don't understand anything...
// Useless
normal

testCases.testIn:

// Useless
normal
I don't understand anything...
Very Strange !!!

testCases.title: Test 5
testCases.testIn:
2
One theory is that she wanted to ensure that the "younger nieces did not read any of Jane's sometimes acid or forthright comments on neighbours or family members".
In the interest of protecting reputations from Jane's penchant for honesty and forthrightness, Cassandra, it is surmised, may have omitted details of illnesses, unhappiness and anything she considered unsavoury.
testCases.testOut: In the interest of protecting reputations from Jane's penchant for honesty and forthrightness, Cassandra, it is surmised, may have omitted details of illnesses, unhappiness and anything she considered unsavoury.

testCases.title: Validator 5
testCases.testIn:
2
In the interest of protecting reputations from Jane's penchant for honesty and forthrightness, Cassandra, it is surmised, may have omitted details of illnesses, unhappiness and anything she considered unsavoury.
One theory is that she wanted to ensure that the "younger nieces did not read any of Jane's sometimes acid or forthright comments on neighbours or family members".
testCases.testOut: In the interest of protecting reputations from Jane's penchant for honesty and forthrightness, Cassandra, it is surmised, may have omitted details of illnesses, unhappiness and anything she considered unsavoury.

data.constraints:
2 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 10
1 ≤ length of a string ≤ 256
It is guaranteed that there will be exactly one string with the greatest percentage of lower case characters.
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read s:string(256)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> A number [[N]] for the number of string to compare.
<<[[N]] next lines :>> A string
data.outputDescription: << Line 1 :>> The string with the greatest percentage of characters in lower case

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You must find the string containing the greatest percentage of lowercase English alphabetical characters (a-z). This percentage is calculated by dividing the total number of lowercase English alphabetical characters by the total number of characters in the string, including whitespace and special characters.
Input
Line 1 : A number N for the number of string to compare.
N next lines : A string
Output
Line 1 : The string with the greatest percentage of characters in lower case
Constraints
2 ≤ N ≤ 10
1 ≤ length of a string ≤ 256
It is guaranteed that there will be exactly one string with the greatest percentage of lower case characters.
Example
Input
2
I am the good one
You not right: Hahahahahahahahahahahahaha!
Output
You not right: Hahahahahahahahahahahahaha!
